extendedIngredients.name: cream cheese block
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 8-ounce block cream cheese, at room temperature

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature

extendedIngredients.name: yellow cake mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 box yellow cake mix, plus ingredients for preparing mix

recipes.title: Popping Poppy Seed Cupcakes

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are great choices for Cupcakes. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. The NV Solera Cream Sherry with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: For the cupcakes: Prepare the cake batter according to the package directions to make cupcakes. Stir in the lemon zest and poppy seeds, pour the batter into cupcake tins and bake according to the package directions. Let cool completely.                          For the frosting: Warm the honey in a small saucepan over low heat. Add the saffron, turn off the heat and let sit until the honey is room temperature.                          In a large bowl, beat together the cream cheese, butter and confectioners' sugar with an electric mixer until smooth. With the mixer running, slowly pour in the cooled honey until fully blended.                          Frost the cupcakes with the cream cheese frosting and garnish them with a sprinkle of poppy seeds.

steps.step: For the cupcakes: Prepare the cake batter according to the package directions to make cupcakes. Stir in the lemon zest and poppy seeds, pour the batter into cupcake tins and bake according to the package directions.
For the frosting: Warm the honey in a small saucepan over low heat.
Add the saffron, turn off the heat and let sit until the honey is room temperature.
In a large bowl, beat together the cream cheese, butter and confectioners' sugar with an electric mixer until smooth. With the mixer running, slowly pour in the cooled honey until fully blended.
Frost the cupcakes with the cream cheese frosting and garnish them with a sprinkle of poppy seeds.
